programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: Comic Legends Of The '80s - Betty White (11/12/81)
programme.desc: Betty White critiques Johnny’s sketch comedy performance and quizzes him on the wonders of nature.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: Hollywood Icons Of The '50s - Orson Welles (9/23/76)
programme.desc: Orson Welles (Citizen Kane) discusses his radio, theatre and movie career which spanned over 5 decades.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: Comic Legends Of The '80s - Dan Aykroyd (6/25/87)
programme.desc: Dan Aykroyd talks Dragnet and Bobby Kelton performs stand-up. Helen Shaver also appears.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: Comic Legends Of The '60s - Carl Reiner (10/5/89)
programme.desc: Carl chats about wife Estelle, a nose injury, forgetfulness, and When Harry Met Sally, by his son Rob Reiner.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: The Best Of Jerry Seinfeld (4/6/82)
programme.desc: Jerry Seinfeld and Charles Grodin share loads of laughs over eyeglasses, doctor visits, and bowling shoes.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: Hollywood Icons Of The '70s - Jodie Foster (3/4/83)
programme.desc: Yale student and movie star Jodie Foster chats about college life and working with Peter O’Toole.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: Comic Legends Of The '80s - Super Dave Osborne (2/10/89)
programme.desc: Stand-up master Super Dave Osborne sends up President George Bush, VP Dan Quayle and….reggae music!

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: Comic Legends Of The '90s - Howie Mandel (11/28/84)
programme.desc: Comic Howie Mandel incites hilarity discussing his wife, his family and his upcoming birthday.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: Hollywood Icons Of The '80s - Carrie Fisher (7/29/83)
programme.desc: Carrie Fisher talks Return of the Jedi and Garry Shandling gets more than a few laughs.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: Comic Legends Of The '80s - Billy Crystal (6/11/86)
programme.desc: Billy Crystal sounds off on cable TV vs. satellite dishes. Plus Arnold Schwarzenegger and Michael Ammar.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: Comic Legends Of The '90s - Bill Maher (8/31/82)
programme.desc: Catch Bill Maher’s first appearance on The Tonight Show. He dishes on President Reagan and VP George Bush.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: Comic Legends Of The '50s - Bob Hope (10/31/80)
programme.desc: The inimitable Bob Hope offers his 2 cents on the Reagan – Carter debate andsleeping in the Lincoln bedroom.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: Comic Legends Of The '90s - Paul Reiser (12/7/89)
programme.desc: Paul Reiser tells Johnny what he says to people, so they’ll think he’s listening to them when he really isn’t.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: Comic Legends Of The '60s - Carl Reiner (10/5/89)
programme.desc: Carl chats about wife Estelle, a nose injury, forgetfulness, and When Harry Met Sally, by his son Rob Reiner.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: Comic Legends Of The '60s - Joan Rivers (5/17/74)
programme.desc: Joan Rivers talks about California living and Vincent Price thinks horror movies are fun.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: Hollywood Icons Of The '50s - Bette Davis (1/7/88)
programme.desc: Bette Davis comments on her Kennedy Center award and President Reagan.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: Animal Antics With Joan Embery (1/1/75)
programme.desc: Celebrate New Year’s day with Foster Brooks, Victor Buono and…..Joan Embery and her gorilla friends.

programme.title: The Johnny Carson Show
programme.sub-title: Hollywood Icons Of The '50s - Tony Curtis (6/21/78)
programme.desc: Tony Curtis discusses novel on Hollywood and the mob. Clip from his first film where he played a rumba dancer.

programme.desc: Comic Howie Mandel incites hilarity discussing his wife, his family and his upcoming birthday.
